commits.message:
CodeMod: Prefer ADD_FAILURE() over EXPECT_TRUE(false), et cetera

Summary:
CodeMod: Prefer `ADD_FAILURE()` over `EXPECT_TRUE(false)`, et cetera.

The tautologically-conditioned and tautologically-contradicted boolean expectations/assertions have better alternatives: unconditional passes and failures.

Reviewed By: Orvid

Differential Revision:
D5432398

Tags: codemod, codemod-opensource

fbshipit-source-id: d16b447e8696a6feaa94b41199f5052226ef6914

torch/fb/fbcunn/src/CuBLASWrapper.cpp: fix gcc-5-exposed (read)buffer-overrun

Summary:
We should all be migrating to gcc-5, for the improved performance of its
generated code and for its improved diagnostics/portability.

Do not reference stride_[1] when "Dim" is 1.

This avoids the following errors:

  In file included from torch/fb/fbcunn/src/CuBLASWrapper.h:4:0,
                   from torch/fb/fbcunn/src/CuBLASWrapper.cpp:3:
  cuda/DeviceTensor.cuh: In function 'void facebook::deeplearning::torch::matmult(facebook::cuda::DeviceTensor<float, Dim>&, const facebook::cuda::DeviceTensor<float, Dim>&, const facebook::cuda::DeviceTensor<float, Dim>&, const facebook::deeplearning::torch::BLASParameters&) [with int Dim = 1]':
  cuda/DeviceTensor.cuh:147:19: error: array subscript is above array bounds [-Werror=array-bounds]
  cuda/DeviceTensor.cuh:147:19: error: array subscript is above array bounds [-Werror=array-bounds]
  cuda/DeviceTensor.cuh:147:19: error: array subscript is above array bounds [-Werror=array-bounds]

Reviewed By: yfeldblum

Differential Revision: D4976050

fbshipit-source-id: f540290f8763b29b52668041e6d0147542ab4a1f

torch/fb/fbcunn/src/TemporalConvolutionFBHost.cpp: remove bogus CHECK_EQ

Summary:
I spotted this line as part of t15678318's mini crusade:

  CHECK_EQ(inputWidth, inputWidth);

I'm happy to replace it with a correction, but being unsure,
and hearing from nicolasvasilache that this is mostly dead code, it
is better just to remove it.

Update nn to 5989f82800a640ed0f5613c8ef3e417c4502661d and cunn to 64224a65eff88d1bfe5bc47d26a901ed8c0b4705.

Summary:
Update nn and cunn.
Also added NN_HEAD and CUNN_HEAD for tracking upstream sync points; I wrote some scripts to do this sync automatically,
but didn't commit them yet because they probably need some resume functionality for the cases where there are merge conflicts.

This required some reworking of how THCUNN is defined in TARGETS, i.e. the non-generic .cu files are the source files,
everything else is a header file.  And need to pass -I to the preprocessor for our macro definitions to work correctly.

Finally, needed to implement the equivalent of "Fix shared function override for specific modules" from nn in fbcunn,
otherwise some tests would fail with stack overflows.

Reviewed By: soumith

Differential Revision: D4438135

Codemod folly::make_unique to std::make_unique

Summary: Folly will soon be dropping support for GCC 4.8, which means that `folly::make_unique` will be going away, so codemod away as much as possible before then.

issue_comments.body: tested with unit tests and with imagenet example
not going to merge this in, seems like it does not have a lot to offer and there is no code simplification.
maybe make your default tensor type as FloatTensor? to compare apples to apples...

i've fixed more bugs in this commit: https://github.com/facebook/fbcunn/commit/968e2a6e97c896066ded891f45143591a5521c09

but your test still does not pass. looking into it.

YOUR TEST IS WRONG! 

Your code:

``` lua
function copyTable(x)  -- Shallow copy
  local ret = {}
  for i = 1, #x do ret[i] = x[i] end
  return ret
end
```

Correct code:

``` lua
function copyTable(x)  -- Shallow copy
  local ret = {}
  for k,v in pairs(x) do ret[k] = v end
  return ret
end
```
hmm that is weird, our internal tests pass. i am looking at if we are out of sync.
oh, i guess we never finished the dynamic part, and there were no unit tests for the dynamic case. Thanks a lot Nicolas!
thanks for this. we actually included almost all of fbcunn's LookupTableGPU speedups back into the original nn version. That version, afaik, is as performant (or better) than LookupTableGPU.

commit_comments.body:
the memory is not being freed, it is being passed to the main thread.
wrt the tensor being freed, yes it will wait till the next garbage collection run, i did not need to aggressively do this, i just waited for the garbage collection to kick in eventually.

fixed in trunk, thanks for the suggestion. yes i do have too much memory :)
Also added more examples in the trunk version (as well as more documentation).
I've added a pure cudnn version (which does not take the extra memory like the fft convolution) and a cunn version, both are activated with the -backend flag.
More documentation here: https://github.com/facebook/fbcunn/tree/master/examples/imagenet#running

commits.message: Update README.md
Imagenet Example: test: Fix typo.
Imagenet Example: Include all validation images in test().
Bugfix: in case of validation, indices are going through the whole dataset and not the just over validation subset.

issue_comments.body: Well, I was thinking that the grad accumulation order will not be the same for the CPU and GPU... So I don't expect matching floating point errors.  Therefore, my thinking was to use double for the CPU because it will be at least a reasonable ground truth value.  I'm more than happy to change it though.
Dam it.  I'm so sorry.  I hope I didn't waste too much of your time.
Well at least we have a working unit test now :-)

Thanks Soumith.  Sorry again.

issue_comments.body: I cannot do that @soumith, because @kafkafield does not have an active CLA on file.

commit_comments.body:
On my machine, I need to add a call to `collectgarbage()` after those two lines to get the memory freed.
Is this handled automatically by the GC for you?

It looks like you have a lot of GPU memory. This breaks on my small graphics card. 
What about doing the clone on CPU?

``` lua
model:float()
local fmodel = model:clone()
```

This may have broken the install for non Fedora etc, as the -e exits on any error:
....
grep -q "ID=fedora" /etc/os-release &> /dev/null
    if [[ "x$?" == "x0" ]]; then
nImgs in line 37 is not defined anywhere. nTest seems to be intended.
